result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 4579 County Road Q, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States

10:06 AM Defendant Calliston J Stimac in court.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Calliston J Stimac.  Bond continued  
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:01 PM Defendant Calliston J Stimac in court. Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he contacted Public Defender yesterday but they did not have time to appoint counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Paul Zalewski is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. On 1/17/22 he was dispatched to Dollar General store regarding a male slumped over in a vehicle in the parking lot. He identifies the defendant in the courtroom as the person that was in the vehicle. There was also a female passenger in the vehicle. She had a straw with drug substance on it. He also found a pill that was a schedule II narcotic. He stated that he did not have a prescription.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
